intro: Cremaspora triflora subsp. confluens, commonly known as the confluence creamball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific care to flourish.
